title: Select
name: Select
description:
Used inside cfform, cfselect lets you construct a drop-down list box form control. You can
  populate the drop-down list box from a query, or using the option tag. Use option elements to populate
  lists. The syntax for the option tag is the same as for its HTML counterpart.

attributes.name: datafld
attributes.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

attributes.name: caseSensitive
attributes.description: is compare for selected case sensitive or not

attributes.name: datasrc
attributes.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

attributes.name: dataformatas
attributes.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

attributes.name: dir
attributes.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

attributes.name: lang
attributes.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

attributes.name: onmousedown
attributes.description:
JavaScript to run
            when the user releases a mouse button in the control.

attributes.name: onmouseup
attributes.description:
JavaScript to run
            when the user presses a mouse button in the control.

attributes.name: onmouseover
attributes.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

attributes.name: onmousemove
attributes.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

attributes.name: onmouseout
attributes.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

attributes.name: onkeypress
attributes.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

attributes.name: onkeyup
attributes.description:
JavaScript to run
            when the user releases a keyboard key in the control.

attributes.name: onkeydown
attributes.description:
JavaScript to run when the user depresses a keyboard
            key in the control.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the form you are creating.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Number of entries in the drop-down list.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description:
Yes or No. If Yes, a list element must be selected when the form is submitted, and the size of
		the drop-down list must be at least two. Default is No.

attributes.name: message
attributes.description: Message that displays if required = 'Yes' and no selection is made.

attributes.name: onError
attributes.description: The name of a valid JavaScript function to execute in the event of a failed validation.

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description:
Yes or No. Yes permits selection of multiple elements in the drop-down list box. The default
		is No.

attributes.name: query
attributes.description: Name of the query to be used to populate the drop-down list box.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: A value matching at least one entry in value to preselect the entry in the drop-down list box.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The query column value for the list element. Used with the query attribute.

attributes.name: display
attributes.description: The query column displayed. Defaults to the value of value. Used with the query attribute.

attributes.name: passThrough
attributes.description:
HTML attributes that are not explicitly supported by cfselect. If you specify an attribute and
		its value, the attribute and its value are passed to the HTML code that is generated for the cfselect
		tag.

attributes.name: class
attributes.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: ID for form input element.

attributes.name: onChange
attributes.description:
JavaScript to run
            when the control changes due to user action.

attributes.name: onClick
attributes.description: JavaScript to run when the user clicks the control.

attributes.name: onDblclick
attributes.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

attributes.name: onFocus
attributes.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

attributes.name: style
attributes.description:
Lucee passes the
            style attribute to the browser.

attributes.name: tabIndex
attributes.description: passed through to form tag created, only used for type html.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Label to put next to the control on a Flash or XML-format form.

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.description:
Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control.
            Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is
            blank.
            Default: true

attributes.name: group
attributes.description:
Query column to use to group the items in the drop-down
            list into a two-level hierarchical list.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: The height of the control, in pixels.

attributes.name: queryPosition
attributes.description:
If you populate the options list with a query and use HTML
            option child tags to specify additional entries, determines
            the location of the items from the query relative to the items
            from the option tags:
             - above: Put the query items above the options items.
             - below: Put the query items below the options items.
            Default: above

attributes.name: tooltip
attributes.description: Flash only: Text to display when the mouse pointer hovers over the control.

attributes.name: visible
attributes.description:
Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control.
            Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is
            blank.
            Default: true

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: The width of the control, in pixels.

attributes.name: editable
attributes.description:
Boolean value specifying whether you can edit the
                    contents of the control.
